definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
formal recommendation letter in eight columns

sentences.english: The demotic scripts and the Semi-cursive script developed in parallel complementarily.
sentences.chinese: 通俗书法类型与行书同步发展，互为补充。

sentences.english: I write using a word processor.
sentences.chinese: 行书是我国书写文字的一种方法。

sentences.english: The Zhao Zhiqian running script is the rubbing from a stone inscription union side high achievement.
sentences.chinese: 赵之谦行书是碑帖结合的极高成就。

sentences.english: Portrait of Wang Xizhi, the great Jin calligrapher, famed for his semi-cursive writing.
sentences.chinese: 图为最擅长写行书的晋代大书法家王羲之。

sentences.english: For those who are writing very fast they have semi-cursive and cursive script.
sentences.chinese: 写得快一些的话，还有行书和草书。

definition: Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
a rubbing from a stone inscription
